Description: * Job Title: IT Business AnalystBusiness Function: IT Project Management Office Enterprise Delivery* Job Overview: You will be a key influencer within the team, driving ideation through to delivery and implementation of solutions. You will be expected to work closely with business stakeholders ensuring decisions are fact based, that the team appropriately defines the vision, empathizes with the customer, ensures customer value is prioritized, and will groom the backlog to ensure fit for purpose and ready for development.* Accountabilities: * Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand key business objectives and ideas to help define and transform them into a scoped and sized business change including definition of minimal value product (MVP).Establish a requirements management strategy which describes; process for elicitation, documentation standards and format, tools, meeting cadence, backlog grooming process, review & approval process, change process, and communications processes.Elicit business requirements and document in the form of a vision statement, visual models/process flows, business objectives, goals, and success criteria.Elicit functional and non-functional requirements and document in the form of epics,Write user acceptance test (UAT) scripts and facilitate user acceptance testing* Competencies and Qualifications: * Bachelors degree or 5+ years experience as a Business Analyst2-3 years experience in Agile/Scrum, supporting Agile effortsExperience with Agile management tools a plus (e.g. ADO, TFS, Jira)Experience of Lean Canvas & Customer Value Proposition is desirableExcellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with diverse groups, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.Experienced in various business analysis techniques including; data modeling, feature decomposition, context diagrams, stakeholder analysis, state diagrams, wireframes, functional requirements, non-functional requirements, use cases, business process definition, user stories, and backlog management.Scrum Master or Product Owner certification a plusIIBA or CBAP Business Analyst certification a plusExperience working the utility industry would be beneficial* Job Type: Contract* Pay: $45.00 per hour* Schedule:* 8 hour shift*  Monday to Friday* Ability to commute/relocate:* Bluffdale, UT 84065: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)* Experience:* tech or IT business analyst: 4 years (Required)*  supporting agile / scrum efforts: 2 years (Required)* Work Location: One location*

Title: Security Architect
Description: * Life is Short. Solve Hard Problems with Cool People. * Idaho Scientific is the Goldilocks of technology firms, combining the spirit of growth of a startup, with a financial footing and safety of a stable corporation. The perks of working at Idaho Scientific include all the benefits you'd expect from an employer who prioritizes a balanced human experience:* Competitive Pay*  Flexible Work Schedule*  Health Benefits and Insurance*  Retirement Fund Contributions*  Profit Sharing*  Generous Paid Time Off Policy* Solve the Problem, Not the Symptom. * Idaho Scientific designs and deploys secure system solutions through novel CPU design, crypto cores, purpose-built system-on-a-chip architectures and hardened operating systems. Our solutions are the foundation for how military systems will remain safe and secure in the conflicts of the future. We need smart people like you to join us in solving hard problems that matter.* What You'll Do: * Advise customers on security architectures, vulnerabilities, countermeasures, and design principles, best practices and system security engineering process and approvals*  Develop architecture design and recommend architectural changes in existing systems to reduce system vulnerabilities*  Evaluate existing or proposed system architectures for reverse engineering and cyber exploitation vulnerabilities*  Explore and document vulnerabilities in an attack countermeasure tree and recommend software and hardware controls to address those vulnerabilities*  Stay current with threat, vulnerabilities, and countermeasure solutions*  Develop demonstrations, test plans, and test software, as needed*  Provide security recommendations to relevant government and commercial standards, policies and procedures*  Distill complex technical concepts into clear and concise writing to support proposals for new business*  Contribute to new product ideas*  Participate in all aspects of the product design life cycle including system architecture, design, development, and verification* Required Qualifications & Experience* US Citizenship*  Ability to get a security clearance*  Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field*  Ability to clearly capture complex technical concepts in writing for both technical and general audiences*  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills*  Must be highly creative and have experience interfacing directly with DoD customers*  Advanced understanding of computer hardware and software architectures, including being able to clearly articulate how a CPU works, how an FPGA works, how Operating Systems work, and how user-space application runtime environments work*  Advanced knowledge of cryptographic systems and algorithms, including what algorithms are approved for US DoD use, when and how to use each algorithm, vulnerabilities of each algorithm and vulnerabilities inherent to an implementation of each algorithm*  Advanced knowledge of attacks and vulnerabilities against hardware and software, as well as an understanding of the US DoD expectations for acceptable residual vulnerabilities*  More than 3 years of proven past performance in US DoD anti-tamper systems security design; preference given to candidates who have worked as a US government employee or at a major US defense prime contractor* Preferred Qualifications & Experience* Active US Security Clearance*  Working knowledge of applied cryptography*  Experience applying principles of cyber security to operational technology and embedded systems*  Experience reverse engineering hardware and software*  Experience developing program protection plans for US weapons systems*  Intimate knowledge of anti-tamper approval process from concept to approval for Direct Commercial Sale and Foreign Military Sales*  Preference given to candidates with a background experience in hardware or software development experience*  Familiarity with real-time/embedded operating systems (VxWorks, Linux) and FPGA/ASIC architecture fundamentals*  Experience with software assurance, system integrity, trust strategies, supply chain exploitation methods and countermeasures and/or general vulnerability analysis*  Experience with CPU design, preferably Intel x86*  Knowledge of Operating System architecture and design, Linux preferred* Location* The preferred work location is at Idaho Scientific headquarters in Boise, Idaho or in Salt Lake City, Utah* Commitment to Diversity.Idaho Scientific is an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will not be discriminated against due to race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition including pregnancy, or any protected category prohibited by local, state or federal laws.* Job Type: Full-time* Pay: $150,000.00 - $220,000.00 per year* Benefits:* 401(k)*  Dental insurance*  Flexible schedule*  Health insurance*  Health savings account*  Paid time off*  Vision insurance* Schedule:* Day shift*  Monday to Friday* Supplemental Pay:* Bonus pay* Application Question(s):* Will you be able to reliably commute or relocate for this job?* Education:* Bachelor's (Preferred)* Work Location: Multiple Locations*

Title: Quality Control Inspector
Description: The Quality Control Inspector/Specialist provides operational/administrative support to the Quality function, coordinates, and performs quality assurance activities.*Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Perform in-process and/or final inspection of products in accordance with acceptance criteria, internal standards and customer requirements.Record, analyze and report performance of inspection activities.Control and report nonconforming material.Coordinate inspection activities with production personnel.Research and resolve identified quality issues with management and Client Services team.Maintain quality records and attend production, program or project meetings, as assigned.Promote product quality, process improvement and customer satisfaction.Follow the Safety, Security and Housekeeping protocols.Other duties as requested/assigned.*Qualifications:*To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily and possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*1. Education, Experience and Training (Knowledge):Associates Degree from two-year college or university; plus one to two years related Quality Inspection experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and/or work-related experience.General knowledge of technology to include computers and software programs, such as MS Office (Word, Excel.)*2. Skills and abilities:Strong verbal, written and listening skills; ability to read, understand, follow and clearly communicate SOPs, supervisor's instructions and work orders.*Ability to identify production or quality issues.Pays attention to details; maintains complete and accurate records.Use self-management skills to plan, organize and prioritize work activities to use time efficiently.Good interpersonal skills; ability to work effectively with others in a team environment.Gain cooperation among team members and leaders.Works well under general supervision*Certificates and Licenses: Certified Quality Auditor certification is a plus.*Work Environment and Physical Demands:*The work environment and physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.*This position requires the ability to lift a maximum of 50 pounds and the ability to sit or stand for extended periods of time.*The working environment will include a manufacturing environment where employee may encounter physical discomfort due to temperature, dust, noise and the like, as well as an operations environment, where the employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts and fumes or airborne particles and the noise level is moderate.*Job Context:*Regularity of Working Hours: Regular (occasionally Irregular)*Day Night Schedule: Basic Day but may be periodically assigned to alternative shift schedule.*Travel: 0%*Equipment, Tools, Machinery:*Computer, laptop, keyboard, monitor, mouse, copier, scanner, fax machines, printer, telephone, cell phone and wireless devices.*Company equipment, such as scales, shrink wrapper, pallet wrapper, and product bander.

Title: Manager, Cyber Security - Google Cloud Security Architect
Description: Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today's most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It's also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it's no wonder we're consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you're as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.*KPMG is currently seeking a Manager, Cyber Security - Google Cloud Security Architect to join its consulting practice*Responsibilities: Deliver cloud transformation and security engagements at industry leading clients using Google Cloud Platform services Executing on Google Cloud security engagements during different phases of the lifecycle - assess, design, and implementation. Drive enterprise focused security improvements to products and solutions built on Google Cloud. Implementation of industry leading practices around cyber risks and Cloud security for clients Lead cloud security strategy, readiness and implementation engagements and be familiar with cloud security frameworks, standards and requirements for security operations Assist KPMG project teams to help clients with secure transformation to GCP or multi-cloud environments from existing on-premises environments and from other cloud providers* Lead and develop Whitepapers / Point of Views (PoV) and other technical materials. Design, implement, and manage DevSecOps capabilities in Google cloud offerings using CI/CD toolsets and automation Lead and mentor teams of Cloud security architects and engineers*Qualifications* A minimum of five years of relevant experience with solutioning, designing and implementing one or more of the Google Cloud security services such as Cloud Security Command Center, Cloud Armor, Chronicle, Google Key Management, Event Threat Protection, Beyond Corp Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience At least one Google Cloud Professional, and/or Security certification or equivalent with any other major CSP’s viz AWS, Azure.* Experience with security concepts and themes around, Cloud IAM, SAML, SSO, SOAR, etc. Knowledge of fundamental cloud infrastructure security challenges, mitigation controls, target state design and tooling and leading cloud security risk assessments while demonstrating an understanding of cloud security risks and controls and define mitigation controls using Google cloud Experience working with senior management and security/technology engineering teams (CISO, CIO, CTO, Architecture review boards, Security review board, application security and SecOps) and participating in requirement gathering workshops and meetings Ability and willingness to travelKPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. The attached link contains further information regarding the firm's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please.*At KPMG, any partner or employee must be fully vaccinated or test negative for COVID-19 in order to go to any KPMG office, client site or KPMG event. In some circumstances, individuals who are not fully vaccinated may also be required to have a reasonable accommodation to not be fully vaccinated for COVID-19.

Title: Designated Support Engineer
Description: Company Description*Trellix is a global company redefining the future of cybersecurity. The company’s open and native extended detection and response (XDR) platform helps organizations confronted by today’s most advanced threats gain confidence in the protection and resilience of their operations. Trellix’s security experts, along with an extensive partner ecosystem, accelerate technology innovation through machine learning and automation to empower over 40,000 business and government customers. More at https://trellix.com.**Job Description**The FireEye Designated Support Engineer (DSE) provides the best possible customer service to the company’s most important customers. They bring deep knowledge of FireEye products, related technologies, and their customers’ deployments to solve problems quickly and provide proactive guidance. DSEs are the most elite role in FireEye’s customer support organization, with advanced technical, problem solving, account management, and customer interaction skills.**DSEs support a small set of customers, typically no more than 4. This senior role has wide discretion to act in the best interest of their customers, orchestrating assistance from any other FireEye technical support, professional services, sales, or engineering organizations. As the most senior members of the customer support organization, DSEs also mentor the more junior members of the Technical Support team and help them develop their technical and customer interaction skills.**What You Will Do:*Serve as first contact for technical support issues, lead escalation response and develop ongoing relationship with customer and become their advocate.*Provide proactive guidance and encourage adoption and assist in deployment of new product releases.*Manage the status and internal and customer communications of service requests, product requests, defects, customer project plans, etc.*Collaborate with support management to orchestrate support response beyond the DSEs direct capability and conduct regular reviews (at least quarterly) of service delivery quality, industry threat assessments and solicit feedback on service delivery and product capabilities and quality.*Qualifications**Requirements:*10+ yrs of overall experience*Demonstrated proficiency with security as it relates to intrusion detection and security tools and technologies*Fundamental understanding of an operating system; for example, understands job control, soft and hard links or shortcuts, distinctions between the kernel and the user environment*Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing with customers as well as with internal engineers*Excellent communication skills, self-motivated, self-starter, sense of urgency, personable, well organized, attention to detail*Must be able to work in the US without sponsorship*Additional Qualifications:*Desired security network, and systems related professional certifications are a plus*Linux, Unix System administration, TCP/IP, DNS, and troubleshooting experience*Completion of job-related technical trainings*Firewall, VPN, IDS and related network security design and implementation

Title: Information Security Analyst
Location: Salt Lake City, UT 84111 (Downtown area)+1 location
Description: * *  *   *    *     *      *       *        *         *          If you are a current employee who is interested in applying to this position, please navigate to the internal *          *           Careers*          *           site to apply.*         *        *       *      *     *    *   *  *  *  *    Information Security Analyst*  *  *  *    Who is MarketStar?*  *  *    Rated as a Top Workplace in 2019, 2020, and 2021, MarketStar employs over 1500 people across 60+ countries and is headquartered in Ogden, UT. Our employees are our greatest assets. We look for professionals who are eager to learn, grow, and perform for the clients we represent. With a culture of success and an empowered, tech savvy workforce, MarketStar continuously delivers great experiences to our employees and our clients every day. Our employees have helped launch, sell, and support thousands of products and services on behalf of some of the most innovative tech companies across the globe!*  *  *  *    At MarketStar, we are sales experts. We offer Sales as a Service™ to our clients by providing data-driven insights, powerful technology, and highly specialized support. This allows us to help our clients streamline their sales process, exceed sales goals, and ultimately grow their business. We have consistently delivered exceptional sales results representing our clients for over 30 years.*  *  *  *    Our actions are based on our core values, and a relentless desire to achieve our purpose – To Create Growth. We are excited to have you apply to work with us! “You Belong” is one of the MarketStar core values and we look forward to helping you find belonging and purpose here.*  *  *  *    About the Information Security Analyst:*  *  *    MarketStar currently has an open opportunity available for an Information Security Analyst*  *  *    The Information Security Analyst reports to the Vice President of Global Privacy and Security and will work closely with business units across all our global locations to audit processes, procedures, and outcomes. You will proactively identify risk points within the business and work with the appropriate business owners to remediate those risks.*  *  *    This role is primarily oriented towards our GRC (Governance, Risk & Compliance) needs and is focused on embedding agile information and security frameworks, systems and policies that help protect MarketStar and it’s clients. To be successful, you must be passionate about information security and growing your career. As MarketStar is an international business, another key component to success requires you to be a self starter, comfortable within a face-paced environment, collaborating with multiple teams across the globe.*  *  *  *    Location: Salt Lake City, UT - Hybrid*  *  *  *    What will you do?*  *  *    Management of SOC 2 and ISO Certification controls along with associated evidence gathering and department compliance*  *  *    Participation on IT Change Advisory Board*  *  *    Management of vulnerability monitoring*  *  *    Network monitoring*  *  *    Participation on Incident Management team*  *  *    Participation in BCP planning and incident response*  *  *    Participation in TTX’s (Tabletop Exercises) for multiple BCP scenarios across our global footprint*  *  *    Participation in Red/Blue team exercises*  *  *    Review of client contracts which have specific security exhibits/call outs*  *  *    Completion of client security questionnaires*  *  *    A key stakeholder in client security audits*  *  *    Vendor/Partner annual security reviews*  *  *    Engage with clients and drive client discussions or negotiations on security*  *  *    Create and implement strategy*  *  *    Monitoring tools management and improvements (GRC, Risk Register, etc)*  *  *  *    Skills & Qualifications:*  *  *    1-2+ years’ experience in a security and compliance environment*  *  *    Excellent organisational and problem-solving skills*  *  *    SOC 2 Audit process familiarity*  *  *    ISO 27001 Audit process familiarity*  *  *    Working knowledge of industry cybersecurity threats, incident response methodologies*  *  *    A degree in Computer Science, InfoSec and/or relevant Cyber Security Certifications is a distinct advantage*  *  *    Working knowledge of GDPR, CCPA, and other cybersecurity/privacy laws*  *  *    Flexibility to schedule working hours to accommodate US/European time zones*  *  *    Strong written and verbal communication skills*  *  *    Must understand and be driven to maintain defined processes and procedures*  *  *    Self-driven*  *  *  *    What’s Highly Desirable?*  *  *    Experience in assessing an IT infrastructure with respect to security mechanisms, network topology and best practice security hygiene.*  *  *    Experience in project management and auditing.*  *  *    Ability to understand legal documents such as DPA’s, InfoSec security requirements, or other legal agreements surrounding security*  *  *    Professional certification (e.g., CISA, CISSP, CompTIA Security+) or working towards same is a distinct advantage.*  *  *  *    MarketStar Benefits & Perks:*  *  *    In our commitment to our “We Care” value, we believe in providing employees with valuable mental and physical well-being benefits including:*  *  *    Paid Parental Leave*  *  *    Paid Childcare/Dependent Care*  *  *    Education Reimbursement*  *  *    Mental Health Benefit*  *  *    401(k) Match*  *  *    4.5 weeks PTO and 7 paid holidays*  *  *    Personal Loan Program*  *  *    And comprehensive health and welfare plans*  *  *  *    This is an exempt position*  *  *  *    MarketStar is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state, and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination. Reasonable accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you are an individual with a disability and require reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the job application process, please contact us at*    talentacquisition@marketstar.com*    for assistance.*  * *

Title: Technical Architect (Remote)
Location: Remote in Salt Lake City, UT
Description: * *  *   Company Description: *   *    LiveArea, a Merkle Company, is a global commerce services company. We combine business strategy, experience design and technology to help leading B2C and B2B organizations deliver exceptional commerce solutions worldwide. We are a diverse team with distinct interests, skillsets, and backgrounds collaborating across all facets of commerce. Together, we take pride in driving measurable and material value for our clients by leveraging our holistic commerce expertise within specific industry vertical markets. *   *  *  *   Job Description: *   *    LiveArea, a Merkle Company, is looking for a SMB Technical Architect that has a strong foundation in PHP and MySQL on a Linux platform. This person will have experience working with an application from the operating system through coding from backend to front. The SMB Technical Architect is responsible for designing complex technical solutions and providing technical expertise across multiple projects to meet client B2C and B2B requirements. This individual must have proven experience creating scalable, maintainable, and well documented solutions based on the Magento software platform and/or other PHP-based platforms. As an active team member, a successful Technical Architect will create complex site architectures to support multiple integration points, oversee the implementation of the design, attend client discovery meetings, estimate new projects, explain highly technical concepts to clients and non-technical teammates, and help resolve technical issues as needed.*     Responsibilities include:*     Provide solution architecture for the business problem, platform integration with third party services, designing and developing complex features for clients' business needs.*      Utilize understanding of Magento's code structure and extension architecture to develop sound technical strategies.*      Assist sales teams in project estimation and questions that arise during the pre-sales process.*      Engage with business stakeholders to understand required capabilities, integrating business knowledge with technical solutions.*      Thorough understanding of Mobile First, Responsive Web Design, and UX concepts - with the ability to put them into practice.*      Experience designing and implementing thorough development and testing workflows.*      Able to quickly learn new processes, software, and technology and apply it to your daily routine*      Have experience optimizing web server configurations and scaling web applications.*      Looking for a chance to create engaging and interactive e-commerce applications.*      You love building both back-end and front-end code for new or existing web applications.*      You stay ahead of web developments and trends and are passionate about collaborating with like-minded teams of engineers to share your interests.*    *  *  *   Qualifications: *   *    Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a closely related field strongly preferred; Master’s degree; or commensurate experience*      Experience in project and solution estimation and team structure definition.*      Engage with business stakeholders to understand required capabilities, integrating business knowledge with technical solutions.*      Broad knowledge of program, project and knowledge management processes and tools.*      In-depth experience in translating account needs into a strategic implementation plan.*      Demonstrated skills in negotiation and leadership. Demonstrated excellence in written and oral communications, including presentations to senior management.*      Must possess a comprehensive and detailed knowledge of issues within the Internet economy, which may include third-party solution providers and competitors.*      Experience in defining new architectures and ability to drive an independent project from an architectural standpoint.*      Demonstrated ability to work comfortably with senior and peer management.*      Deep expertise in on-line, on-demand technologies and cutting-edge training methods.*      7+ years’ PHP development experience required.*      Proficiency with PHP frameworks such as Zend framework.*      In depth experience with HTML/CSS, JavaScript & JQuery, XML, MySQL, PHP.*      Proficiency with PHP and MySQL from an OOP perspective, database schema design, LAMP Server administration.*      You want to participate in project planning, design review, and architectural meetings.*      Competent knowledge of e-commerce data organization and relationships.*    *     Characteristics:*     Professional – unquestionable integrity, credibility, and character; Who has demonstrated high moral and ethical behavior.*      Excellent verbal, written and presentation communication skills.*      Demonstrable ability to provide consulting services.*      Must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy, a big-picture vision and the ability to articulate a vision of the total solution both internally and externally.*    *  *  *   Additional Information: *   *    Benefits*     Multiple health plan options, including independent insurance and pre-tax FSAs*      Life insurance, AD&D, and short- and long-term disability with company-paid premium*      Ample paid time off, holidays, and flex time*      Generous full paid leave for new parents, including parental, maternity, paternity, and adoption leave and assistance*      Military leave for active duty service members deployed to full-time service*      401(k) retirement savings plan with company-sponsored matching program*    *     Employees from diverse or underrepresented backgrounds encouraged to apply. Dentsu (the "Company") is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee of the Company, on the basis of age, sex, sexual orientation, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage or citizenship, disability, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other legally-recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and/or certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done that will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing an undue hardship on the Company. Please contact recruiting@dentsuaegis.com if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process or to request or discuss an accommodation in connection with a job at the Company to which you are applying.*     For individuals assigned to and/or hired in Colorado, the anticipated salary range for this position is $120K - $175K, which is based on a wide range of factors that include relevant experience, knowledge, skills and other job-related qualifications. Pay ranges in locations other than Colorado may differ based on labor market wage rates in those locations. A range of medical, dental, vision, 401(k) matching, paid time off, and/or other benefits also are available. For more information regarding dentsu benefits, please visit https://dentsubenefitsplus.com/*     #LI-LD1*   *  * *  * *  More Information: *  Our Culture: Merkle’s energy and personality lives through everything we say and do. Learn all about what defines our people and our vibe. *  Students & Recent Graduates: Start your career at Merkle and get on the path to success. *  Experienced Hires: Leverage your expertise, challenge the status quo and grow your career at Merkle.* *

Title: Data Analyst
Description: * Data Analyst * Mountain West Anesthesia is growing quickly as a company. We are looking for someone who can embrace change, has an aptitude to learn and is excited to take on new challenges.* Job Description: * Create and manage reliable data models for a variety of business operations.*  Compile, organize, and analyze data to assist in optimizing healthcare management.*  Develop ad hoc analyses to address specific business questions.*  Regular collaboration with physicians and office personnel on a variety of projects.*  Daily use of Power BI, Excel, and other analytics platforms, including RStudio.*  Assist with other office responsibilities as needed, including HR functions, IT assistance, etc.*  Report automation and optimization.* Qualifications: * Excellent time management skills including the ability to multi-task and prioritize work accordingly.*  Attention to detail and problem-solving skills.*  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.*  Strong organizational and time management skills.*  Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.*  Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.) including a knowledge of Excel Macros, Power Pivot, and Power Query.*  Ability to work with a variety of languages including DAX, M, R, Python, and VBA.*  Ability to effectively communicate findings to a variety of stakeholders.*  Basic understanding of the healthcare industry.*  An intuitive approach to problem solving. Enjoys logic puzzles and self-learning.* The ideal candidate will be a detail oriented, quick thinking, problem solver who is self-motivated, impeccably organized, and will thrive in a fast-paced environment with varying responsibilities and deadlines.* $18-$26 per hour depending on experience*  Full-time permanent position*  Benefits: health, dental, vision, disability, 401K* Education and Work Experience:* Bachelor’s degree in a Data Science, Data Analytics, or business intelligence related field (or equivalent work experience) preferred.* Job Type: Full-time* Pay: $18.00 - $26.00 per hour* Benefits:* 401(k)*  Dental insurance*  Health insurance*  Paid time off*  Vision insurance* Schedule:* 8 hour shift*  Day shift*  Monday to Friday* Work Location: One location*

Title: Product Manager - Telemetry Data Platform, Infrastructure Se...
Description: * *  Your Opportunity *  We’re looking for a product manager to work closely with our database engineer and containerized infrastructure teams, revolutionizing and modernizing our managed services platform within our Infrastructure Services group. You’ll partner with our internal customers to decide what’s needed and how to prioritize those needs. You’ll need to understand the technical realities and be ready to prioritize the architectural roadmap alongside high-demand capabilities.*   You know how to work with engineers and executives, and have a good sense of when to gather more data and when to make a decision and move forward. If you haven’t been a product manager, maybe you’ve done similar work as an architect, engineering leader, or in another leadership role.*   Opportunity to work from a remote office may be available depending on applicant's location.*   What You’ll Do*   Drive the product strategy for internal manage services, advised by internal customers, industry standards, technical capability, and internal initiatives*    Connect with our customers (other product development teams at New Relic) about their challenges and use this information to determine how Site Engineering can provide a frictionless experience to help them achieve their goals.*    Work with teams to provide business context, clear guidance, and success criteria that will delight our customers.*    In collaboration with Engineering, develop a rolling 4-quarter roadmap, drive the alignment of key releases to deliver on the roadmap; adjust the roadmap as needed based on key results, customer demand, and changes in execution resources.*   Your Qualifications*   Must-have:*   2+ years as a Product Manager or Technical Product Manager.*    Experience working with customers to set the roadmap and strategic direction of “internal” infrastructure products like container orchestration tooling, managed databases as a service, load balancing, networking, build and deploy tools, etc.*    Experience in large-scale environments, preferably as part of a SaaS platform.*    Ability to communicate effectively to different audiences both verbally and in writing.*    Excellent analytical/problem-solving skills and track record of using data to drive decisions.*   Nice-to-have:*   Experience as a software developer, architect, or in technical operations*    Product management training and certification*    Hands-on experience with containerized orchestration systems such as Kubernetes*    Experience operating or using database technologies*   Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.*   We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to create more perfect software. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. What's most important to us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes.*   We believe in empowering all Relics to achieve professional, and business success through a workforce model called Flex First. The Flex First model allows us to work in a variety of workplaces that best support our success, including fully office-based, fully remote, or a combination of both.*   Read more about Flex First and New Relic’s vaccine policy as part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and healthy workplace in light of the COVID-19 pandemic.*   About Us*   New Relic (NYSE: NEWR) is a cloud-based observability platform that gives developers, engineers, operations, and management a clear view of what’s happening in today’s complex software environments. So they can find and fix problems faster, and deliver delightful experiences for their customers. That's why the world’s best engineering teams rely on New Relic to visualize, analyze, and troubleshoot their software. It’s the simplest, most powerful cloud-based observability platform, built to create more perfect software. All from one place.*   Founded in 2008, we’re a global company passionate about building a culture where all employees feel a deep sense of belonging, where every ‘Relic’ can bring their whole self to work and feel supported and empowered to thrive. We’re consistently recognized as a distinguished employer and are committed to building world-class products and an award-winning culture. For more information, visit newrelic.com.*   Our Hiring Process*   New Relic takes seriously our stewardship of the data of our thousands of customers worldwide. In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification.*   We will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records based on individual circumstances and in accordance with applicable law including, but not limited to, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. https://sfgov.org/olse/sites/default/files/FCO%20poster2020.pdf*   Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. New Relic does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with New Relic.*   New Relic is an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek a diverse applicant pool and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities (or disability), age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.*   Interested in the details of our privacy policy? Read more here: https://newrelic.com/termsandconditions/applicant-privacy-policy*   Estimated Annual Salary Range: $131,0000 - $164,000 (for Colorado and New York City based roles only)*   Consistent with New Relic's values and applicable law, we provide the following information to improve pay transparency and equity. The salary range above represents a good faith estimate of the low and high-end salary range for the listed position if based in Colorado or New York City. This role is eligible for quarterly or annual bonuses, participation in our stock equity plan, short- and long-term incentives, and other department-specific awards. In addition, New Relic provides a variety of benefits to employees. Please note that this information is provided for those hired in Colorado and New York City only, and this role is open to candidates outside of Colorado and New York City with compensation that aligns with your location.* *

Title: IT Systems and Support Engineer Tier ll
Location: Salt Lake City, UT 84101 (People's Freeway area)
Description: * IT Systems and Support Engineer Tier ll* *Position: *IT Systems and Support Engineer Tier IIType: Full-Time Position, Standard Office HoursLocation:  Salt Lake City, UtahSalary/Pay: $50K - $80K / Year - Commensurate with experience and educationApply At:  https://app.eddy.com/careers/nexusit* Are you an IT Systems and Support Engineer, that’s ready for a new challenge?* Feel like you’ve hit a ceiling, with your present-day Job?*  Ready to take on the commitment of building strong business relationships?*  Ready to start making a real impact in your client relationships?* **Well, you’re reading this, good! This may be the opportunity you’ve been looking for!**Nexus IT is a premier IT Services company (Managed IT Services and Security Services Provider (MSP/MSSP)), that feeds the technology demands and network needs of small and medium-sized businesses across the nation. Each of us make up a brilliant team of dedicated intellectuals, with every role serving an absolute purpose. We are looking for people who will be part of our team and embrace our core values and vibrant culture.* That’s where you come in… Keep reading, it gets better!**Nexus IT is looking to hire an IT Systems and Support Engineer Professional, whose primary responsibility is to manage and maintain our client’s networks. When performed expertly, our clients are provided with white-glove desktop, server, and IT systems support and cybersecurity services. Ensuring 100% client satisfaction and quieting their networks is essential in this position.**Now, let’s talk about why you’d want to work here!**Yes, we have awesome, comprehensive benefits and perks. Those include:* Major Medical Insurance*  Minor Medical Coverage*  Telemedicine, Prescription Discounts, and more*  Mental Health Resources and Access to Mental Health Professionals*  Nexus IT Covers 100% of Employee Dental, Vision, Life, and Long-Term Disability Insurance*  Flex/Unlimited PTO*  Paid Holidays*  Employee Wellness Programs, Coaching, Applications, and Platforms*  Ongoing Employee Personal and Professional Development Programs, and Significant Internal Career Opportunities*  Monthly, Quarterly, and Yearly Incentives and Bonuses*  Quarterly Team Activities, Reconnects, or Retreats*  And more….* Ready for the next step? Good, here are a few final details to consider…**We do not believe that being career-stuck is a strategy. We expect to retain the best, that want to grow as people and professionals, and that’s why we are so bold about what we want – because we expect to find it. Send in your Cover Letter and Resume, to: info@nexusitc.net or apply at the link in this listing, and be sure to list in the cover letter, why this specific role fits into your career path. Only submissions with these articulations, will be considered.* Only local applicants, or those willing to relocate at their own expense, need apply. This position will be based in our downtown Salt Lake City, Utah HQ.* Expected Outcomes: * Success in this position will be based on your ability to meet or exceed our client’s expectations and by exceeding the SLA (Service Level Agreements) put in place for various agreements.*  Engineers are graded on the profitability of the client agreements and on the quality and quantity of closed tickets, speed of ticket closure, and first-time ticket resolution.* Essential Duties and Responsibilities: The IT Systems and Support Engineer II position is a key contributor in the success of managing our client’s networks. This is achieved by quickly resolving incidents that our clients open tickets for and by constantly monitoring the alerts generated by our tools to resolve incidents before our clients are aware. This includes a wide range of technologies, which require general and specific technical expertise in many areas including:* *Server and workstation hardware and software, including Windows, Linux, and Mac* Backup and Disaster Recovery (BDR)*  Cyber Security Defense and Unified Threat Management (UTM)*  Security Monitoring, including SOC and SIEM*  Maintenance of IT Systems*  Installation, service, troubleshooting and repair*  Operating System installation and configuration*  Cloud and virtualization using VMWare and other technologies*  Firewall, Router, Switch installation and configuration*  Centrally Managed WiFi – Mesh, PtP, and PtMP Solutions*  Office 365*  Server Technologies such as Exchange, SQL, IIS, Apache, SharePoint, etc.*  VoIP Phone System install, configuration, repair, and support*  Web Hosting configuration, repair, and support* Knowledge, Skills, and/or Abilities Required: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.* Ability to effectively listen and communicate with team members, partners, and clientele, including excellent written and oral communication skills.*  Ability to successfully prioritize service issues based on multiple competing objectives.*  Ability to work on multiple priorities and/or projects simultaneously.*  Strong customer relationship skills.*  Organized, detail oriented, and self-motivated.*  Ability to provide and maintain detailed documentation on each ticket.*  Intermediate knowledge in servers, routers, layer 2/3 switches, and other networking devices.*  General knowledge in managing Microsoft Server Operating Systems and Networks.*  Advanced knowledge of all Microsoft Workstation Operating Systems and Applications.*  Ability to remain in contact with the client through satisfactory completion of tickets.*  Problem-solving abilities, and ability to meet reasonable deadlines.*  Willingness and commitment to ongoing personal and professional development.*  Ability to work with little supervision.*  Ability to successfully train the client on the new solution(s) implemented.* Educational/Vocational/Previous Experience Recommendations: * Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or IT related studies preferred.*  A+ Certification is required.*  NET+ Certification is required.*  Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP) and/or MCSE are preferred.*  SEC+, CISSP and/or other Cyber Professional related certifications are preferred.*  5+ years’ experience in computer network management is required.*  Experience in managing multiple client networks is preferred.* Working Conditions: * Normal professional, office environment.* Employment Eligibility: * Authorized to work legally in the United States for any employer without requiring sponsorship now or in the future.* *Relocation Note*: We are not providing relocation expenses for this position. If you are not in the Northern Utah area, are not interested in relocating at your own expense or cannot commute regularly to our Salt Lake office - please do not apply for the position. If you are looking at relocating to Northern Utah (which is super awesome, especially with the current tech scene) - please specify that you are willing to relocate and why Northern Utah interests you.* _The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. Other duties may be assigned as needed._* Job Type: Full-time* Pay: $50,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year*

Title: Azure Cloud Architect
Description: * *  Azure Cloud ArchitectDescription*   Do you have proven experience designing and implementing solutions that run on Microsoft Azure? Do you have a passion for infrastructure automation and DevOps practices in Azure? Are you interested in working in a cross-platform environment and design solutions that are deployable across multiple cloud providers? Then you may be the perfect candidate for the job of Azure Cloud Architect at Nice.*   We are expanding our Cloud Architecture team and are looking for a motivated individual to join the team and play a key role to help us build our product portfolio that is hosted in Azure.*   Responsibilities /Essential Duties*  *   Partner with R&D and Cloud Operations teams to optimize products for deployment and management in Azure*    Provide guidance for optimal setup from networking, compute, storage, security, business continuity, budgeting and governance standpoints*    Ability to work in a cross-platform environment to help integrate key technologies used for automation, monitoring, management and reporting into Azure and design cross-platform automation solutions*    Ability to work in a highly distributed team*    Possible travel to other global locations*  *   Education and Experience*   Azure: 5+ years of experience designing, deploying, and managing solutions in Azure with strong hands-on technical skills. Microsoft Azure certifications a plus.*    2-3 years’ experience in technical leadership role.*    Education Level: B.E/B.Tech/M.Tech/M.Sc in Computer Science/IT preferred (or any engineering field considered) or equivalent.*   Knowledge, Skills or Abilities*   Expert understanding of key Azure components and concepts for both IAAS and PAAS including networking, compute, storage, security, Azure managed services and Azure well-architected framework*    Experience working with Load Balancer and Firewalls*    Good coding skills in in Python, Powershell or any other major language highly desired.*    Knowledge of AWS a plus*    Knowledge of Terraform, Puppet or Ansible a plus*    Proven ability to learn new technologies quickly*    Ability to work effectively with distributed team*    Ability to work in high pressure, highly flexible environment against both short and long-term objectives*    Passionate about technology and solving IT operations-focused problems*    Must be detail oriented, task driven, and have excellent communication skills.*    Ability to work effectively with staff, peers, and others in and outside the organization to accomplish goals, objectives and to identify and resolve problems*  *   Company Description*   NICE Systems (NASDAQ: NICE), is the worldwide leader of intent-based solutions that capture and analyze interactions and transactions, realize intent, and extract and leverage insights to deliver impact in real time.*  *   Driven by cross-channel and multi-sensor analytics, NICE solutions enable organizations to improve business performance, increase operational efficiency, prevent financial crime, ensure compliance, and enhance safety and security.*  *   NICE serves over 25,000 organizations in the enterprise and security sectors, representing a variety of sizes and industries in more than 150 countries.* *

Title: Sr. Database Administrator
Description: * *  Sr. Database Administrator*   Location: Salt Lake City, UT*   The Database Administrator will ensure SQL Server database performance and availability in a 24x7 environment.As a Database Administrator, a Typical Day Might Include the Following:*  *    *      Install, configure, upgrade, monitor, maintain and manage multiple SQL Server databases.*    *   *    *      Perform database and application tuning.*    *   *    *      Establish and maintain sound backup and recovery policies and procedures.*    *   *    *      Implement and maintain database security*    *   *    *      Create, maintain and monitor SQL Server replication.*    *   *    *      Perform code review and provide consultation to development teams.*    *   *    *      Provide 24x7 support in an on call rotation with other staff members.*    *   *    *      Setup and maintain documentation and standards.*    *   *    *      Review, approve and create database logical and physical designs.*    *   *    *      Integrate third party software and databases with corporate databases.*    *   *    *      Train other staff as necessary.*    *   *    *      Attend meetings and training as required.*    *   To Land This Gig You'll Need:*   Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business Information Systems, or related field or equivalent work experience required.*    4+ years maintaining SQL Server mission critical databases*    4+ years TSQL programming*    1+ years implementing and maintaining database replication*    Ability to work with technical and non-technical people*    Problem solving skills are a must*    Ability to meet deadlines*   Bonus Experience:*   HP Blade and EVA SAN optimization*    Veritas Net Backup*    MCSE/MCDBA/OCP*    NET technologies*    PowerShell*    C#*  *

Title: Sr. Principal Test Labs Network Engineer 4997-1
Description: * *  Requisition ID: R10043476 *  Category: Information Technology *   Location: Roy, Utah, United States of America *   Citizenship Required: United States Citizenship *   Clearance Type: Secret *   Telecommute: No- Teleworking not available for this position *   Shift: 1st Shift (United States of America) *   Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the Time *   Positions Available: 1*  *   At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.*    Embark on a career putting innovative, reliable, and agile products and ideas into orbit, and beyond. Northrop Grumman has opportunities waiting for you that play a vital role in human space exploration, national defense, and scientific discovery, supporting multiple programs across the universe. With us, you’ll discover a culture of curiosity and collaboration that will have you Defining Possible from the day you start. Our space systems connect and protect millions of people on earth every day, now and for the future. Explore your future and launch your career today.*    Northrop Grumman Space Systems is seeking a Sr. Principal Test Labs Network Engineer. This position will be located in Roy, Utah and will support the Ground Based Strategic Deterrent (GBSD) program*    What You’ll Get To Do:*    Responsibilities include network architecture development and implementation for program test facilities. Support the test team in deployment of network assets, sustainment of systems, network modification verifications, and helping to resolve complex networking issues.*    Essential Functions Include, but are not limited to:*    Responsible for building, integrating, and testing network configurations and or implementing and configuring network hardware in complex IT systems.*     Create Build and Upgrade documentation along with instructions for lab and field engineers/technicians on how to configure and implement network devices within new or current systems.*     Create and maintain network drawings or infrastructure diagrams*     Act as a technical resource and provide tier 1-2 support in response to network issues and various support tasks.*    This position’s standard work schedule is a 9/80. 7 years of experience with a related Master's degreeU.S. Citizenship and the ability to obtain a DoD Secret security clearance*Preferred Qualifications:Active DoD Secret security clearance, or higherMaster of Science in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering7+ years analysis experience of aircraft structures7+ years analysis experience performing Durability and Damage Tolerance of aircraft structures7+ years of experience using FEM software, including FEMAP (Nastran), Abaqus, ANSYS, or similarImplicit or explicit dynamic FEA experience analyzing dynamic environments: static, random vibration, sinusoidal vibration, and shockProvide technical solutions to a wide range of complex difficult problems. Title: Senior Engineer II (Salt Lake City, UT or Portland, OR) #108...

Description: * *  *   *    *    *   *     PacifiCorp is seeking customer-centric candidates to grow and sustain our commitment to a culture of customer service excellence, environmental sustainability and diversity, equity and inclusion.*   *  *  *   *     General Purpose*   *   *   *     Serve as a subject matter expert on a team focused on the implementation of a broad range of transportation electrification (TE) technologies, such as electric vehicles (EV), electric vehicle service equipment (EVSE), fleet electrification, telematics, and data management. Stay up to date on latest technologies and relevant advancements related to EVSE, EVs, understanding market trends and key technology market influencers. Support program implementation and act as technical expert, advising on program design, program evolution and TE strategy. Participate in stakeholder workshops, discussions, working groups, etc. to support the TE future of PacifiCorp. Support technical feasibility and onsite analysis where needed and support TE investments analysis and well as act as SME on site specific projects for both customers and utility sites*   *  *  *   *     Responsibilities*   *   *   *     Design, develop, modify, and evaluate complex systems, process, or facilities to support company objectives, utilizing engineering methods.*      Develop highly complex engineering studies, plans, specifications, calculations, evaluations, design documents, and performance assessments.*      Identify and support analysis and development of innovative opportunities for TE programs and projects which meet corporate objectives and customer needs.*      Work with internal and external stakeholder to support electrification goals including charging infrastructure deployment needs.*      Assist in evaluating TE impacts on utility grid, review load studies and recommend infrastructure upgrade solutions.*      Collect and analyze data and assess the operational and economic feasibility of a broad range of EV technology options.*      Creation, oversight and execution of test protocols and mechanisms to ensure EV charging interoperability with EVs and other delivery station sub-systems*      Provide detailed analysis and understanding of codes and standards related to EVs and EV charging equipment.*      Lead strategy on how team should integrate future of EVSE network chargers fit into central management systems*      Develop and run analytical tools to inform electrification decisions based on data from existing requirements and industry best practices.*      Prepare written reports of results, recommendations, national standards and best practices.*      Contribute in a team environment, while managing on-going development of self-directed work to support a wide range of research and deployment project needs.*      Support the development of new or improved techniques responding to a rapidly developing industry.*    *  *  *   *     Requirements*   *   *   *     Bachelor’s degree in electrical or electronics engineering.*      A minimum of five or more years’ experience in industrial power systems, transportation electrification or electric utility power systems.*      Experience with power distribution/utility electrical products and power electronics.*      Demonstrated knowledge and application of principles in area of engineering specialty.*      Advanced understanding of Electric Vehicle (EV) charging technology and energy management systems (EVSEs, DC fast chargers, and wireless charging systems) a plus*      Basic knowledge of the USA National Electrical Code and understanding of understanding of EV and utility interoperability standards – ISO15118, OCPP 2.0, J1772, OpenADR, IEEE2030.5, and DIN specs..*      Project management and leadership skills including the ability to work as a team member, to maintain project timelines, budgets, and deliver on commitments.*      Understanding of company’s business, and relevant policies, procedures, and practices.*      Knowledge of applicable federal, state, local laws, regulations and the National Electric Codes.*      Ability to perform effectively in high-pressure situations while maintaining focus and calmness.*      Demonstrated communication and interpersonal skills involving the ability to work cross-functionally to understand requirements, present alternatives, and recommendations.*      Proficient with the use of personal computers including automated tools.*    *  *  *   *     Additional Title: Director of Security
Description: * Professional Security Consultants (PSC) is currently interviewing qualified candidates to fill a Director of Security position at Fashion Place Mall, located in Murray, UT. Candidates must be highly driven and have highly skilled management practices.* Candidates must have: * - Strong organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills.* - Effective oral and written communication skills, with the ability to explain complex information and fact patterns in understandable terms to all levels of personnel.* - Effective computer skills, particularly Microsoft Office Outlook, Word, Excel.* ** - A minimum of 3 years of Security Management experience, preferably in retail. A background in law-enforcement is a plus. *** Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: * - Oversees the entire security operations of the site and consistently ensures the highest level of security is being provided.* - Ensures all procedures provide coherent, efficient and complete solutions for all site security needs.* - Stays abreast all security incidents and ensures proper documentation is completed.* - Serves as the site's primary point of contact and liaison between the client and company.* **- Advises in all issues respective to the security of the site affecting both the client and company. *** - Maintains and updates the security teams' Emergency Procedures Manual as needed, including Emergency Preparedness plans for security situations which include: fires; natural disasters; terrorist attacks, etc.* - Continually update and/or creates post orders as well as security policies & procedures.* - Assesses site's training needs and conducts additional training sessions when and where necessary.* Minimum Requirements:* - At least 21 years of age* - Must have, or be able to obtain a state security license* - Legally able to work in the United States* - Be able to communicate effectively in English both verbally and in writing* - High School Diploma, GED or equivalent* Job Type: Full-time* Pay: $62,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year* Benefits:* Dental insurance*  Health insurance*  Vision insurance* Schedule:* 8 hour shift*  Holidays*  Weekend availability* Experience:* Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)* Work Location: One location*

Title: Security Officer
Description: * Professional Security Consultants (PSC) is immediately seeking to hire security officer for part-time position at Mountain View Village, located in Riverton, UT.* Shift hiring for: Part-Time Graveyard* Candidates must be highly driven, have remarkable customer service skills and be available to work weekends.* If interested, please submit your resume to this ad with updated contact information and apply online @ pscsite.com so you can be reached for an interview.* Objectives:* - Security officers are expected to be observant and provide a visible deterrence to crime and disruptions.* - Officers assist guests, enforce rules and regulations, and ensure access control.* - The security officer's mission is to maintain a safe, secure and professional environment by interacting with the public, vendors, client's staff & other event support staff.* Responsibilities (including, but not limited to the following): * - Enforce and comply with company policies, post orders and client instructions.* - Provide a visual deterrence by maintaining high visibility at all times.* - Conduct detailed observations of people and property within their area of responsibility.* - Provide detailed written reports of incidents that occur within their area of responsibility.* - Enforce rules and regulations of the venue at all times.* - Provide access control to authorized persons.* -
